body_html: thanks. so reference of conv2d is misleading. On 2018-08-14 22:00 , Shaba Abhiram<mailto:notifications@github.com> Wrote: The DataType definition calls out that DT_BFLOAT16 = 14; // Float32 truncated to 16 bits. Only for cast ops. You could use an artificially less precise Float32 to emulate 16 bits for the time being. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. body_text:
thanks.  so reference of conv2d is misleading.





On 2018-08-14 22:00 , Shaba Abhiram<mailto:notifications@github.com> Wrote:


The DataType definition calls out that

DT_BFLOAT16 = 14;  // Float32 truncated to 16 bits.  Only for cast ops.


You could use an artificially less precise Float32 to emulate 16 bits for the time being.

—
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.

body:
thanks.  so reference of conv2d is misleading.





On 2018-08-14 22:00 , Shaba Abhiram<mailto:notifications@github.com> Wrote:


The DataType definition calls out that

DT_BFLOAT16 = 14;  // Float32 truncated to 16 bits.  Only for cast ops.


You could use an artificially less precise Float32 to emulate 16 bits for the time being.

—
